FacilityName: Molson Coors USA LLC - Trenton OH

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Molson Coors USA LLC - Trenton Brewery produces malt beverages at the facility located in St. Clair Township, Butler County Ohio. We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner. 



Anhydrous Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 

We take many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and emergency action plan to enable a quick response to any system upsets. 



The PSM Coordinator is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety programs. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. 



The hazard assessments for this facility include a worst case and an alternative case scenario which are available upon request.



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?    Management Systems

?    Employee Participation Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safety Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation Procedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.



E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 

An emergency response program has been implemented at the facility. This program contains procedures describing how the facility will respond to ammonia spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures.  



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

As part of the accidental release and preventions program, the facility strives to continuously improve. We routinely identify several potential changes to improve the safety of our ammonia refrigeration.
